medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric pain, nausea, and vomiting after eating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the previous evening after eating a Whopper, characterized by severe epigastric pain. The pain is currently improved after pain medication and zofran, and the patient is more comfortable. Emesis was non-bloody, non-bilious, with chills but no documented fevers. No recent illnesses or similar symptoms reported in individuals who shared the meal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Shoulder and knee problems; past surgical history denied.
medical_history.family_history: Gallbladder disease, coronary artery disease (CAD), cerebrovascular accident (CVA).
